   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/0, unzip64_central_headers/0,
   36:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   37:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   38:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   39:          uid_gid/1]).
   40: 
   41: -export([zip/5, unzip/3]).
   42: 
   43: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   44: 
   45: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   46: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   47: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   48: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   49: 
   50: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   51: 
   52: all() -> 
   53:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   54:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   55:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   56:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   57:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   58:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   59: 
   60: groups() -> 
   61:     zip_groups().
   62: 
   63: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   64: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   65: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   66: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   67: %% -define(ZIP_MODES,[emzip]).
   68: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   69: %% How much memory the zip/unzip 64 testcases that zip/unzip from/to are expected to use
   70: -define(EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE, (8 * (1 bsl 30))).
   71: 
   72: zip_groups() ->
   73: 
   74:     ZipGroup=
   75:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   76:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   77:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   78:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   79: 
   80:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   81:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   82:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   83:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   84:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   85: 
   86:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   87: 
   88: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   89:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   90: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   91:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   92: 
   93: un_z64(Mode) ->
   94:     case atom_to_list(Mode) of
   95:         "z64_" ++ ModeString -> list_to_atom(ModeString);
   96:         _ -> Mode
   97:     end.
   98: 
   99: zip_testcases() ->
  100:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
  101: 
  102: zip64_testcases() ->
  103:     [unzip64_central_headers,
  104:      zip64_central_directory].
  105: 
  106: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  107:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  108:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  109:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  110: 
  111: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  112:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  113:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: cleanup_priv_dir(Config) ->
  117:     %% Cleanup potential files in priv_dir
  118:     Pdir = get_value(pdir, Config, get_value(priv_dir,Config)),
  119:     ct:log("Cleaning up ~s",[Pdir]),
  120:     [ case file:delete(File) of
  121:         {error, eperm} -> file:del_dir_r(File);
  122:         _ -> ok
  123:     end || File <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Pdir, "*"))].
  124: 
  125: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  126:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  127: 
  128:     SkipZip64 = string:find(os:getenv("TS_EXTRA_PLATFORM_LABEL",""), "Docker") =/= nomatch,
  129:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  130:     DiskFreeKB = disc_free(PrivDir),
  131:     MemFreeB = memsize(),
  132: 
  133:     if SkipZip64 ->
  134:             {skip, "Zip64 tests unstable on docker, do not run"};
  135:        WordSize =:= 4 ->
  136:             {skip, "Zip64 tests only work on 64-bit systems"};
  137:        DiskFreeKB =:= error ->
  138:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  139:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  140:        DiskFreeKB >= 16 * (1 bsl 20), MemFreeB >= ?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE ->
  141:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [DiskFreeKB]),
  142:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [MemFreeB div (1 bsl 20)]),
  143:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  144:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  145:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  146:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  147:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  148: 
  149:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  150:         true ->
  151:             ct:log("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [DiskFreeKB]),
  152:             ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [MemFreeB div (1 bsl 20)]),
  153:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free disk or less then 8 GB free mem"}
  154:     end;
  155: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  156:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  157:         true ->
  158:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  159:                 undefined ->
  160:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= zip orelse has_zip() of
  161:                         true ->
  162:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  163:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  164:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, Group} | Config];
  165:                         false ->
  166:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  167:                     end;
  168:                 _Zip ->
  169:                     case un_z64(Group) =/= unzip orelse has_zip() of
  170:                         true ->
  171:                             Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  172:                             ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  173:                             [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, Group} | Config];
  174:                         false ->
  175:                             {skip, "No zip program found"}
  176:                     end
  177:             end;
  178:         false ->
  179:             Config
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  183:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  184:     Config.
  185: 
  186: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  187:     UsesZip = un_z64(get_value(zip, Config)) =:= zip orelse un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =:= unzip,
  188:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  189:     ct:log("Free memory: ~w MByte~n", [memsize() div (1 bsl 20)]),
  190:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  191:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  192:        true ->
  193:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  194:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  195:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  196:     end.
  197: 
  198: 
  199: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  200:     cleanup_priv_dir(Config),
  201:     Config.
  202: 
  203: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  204: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  205: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  206: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  207:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  208:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  209: 
  210:     Record = 512,
  211:     Block = 20 * Record,
  212: 
  213:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  214:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  215:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  216:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  217:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  218: 
  219:     %% Clean up.
  220:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  221:     ok.
  222: 
  223: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  224:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  225:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  226:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  227: 
  228:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  229:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  230:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  231:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  232:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  233: 
  234:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  235:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  236:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  237:                     info = Info,
  238:                     offset = 0,
  239:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  240:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  241:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  242: 
  243:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  244:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  245:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  246: 
  247: 
  248:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  249:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  250: 
  251:     ok.
  252: 
  253: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  254:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  255:         true ->
  256:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  257:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  258:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  259:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  260:         _ ->
  261:             ok
  262:     end.
  263: 
  264: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  265:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  266: 
  267: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  268:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  269:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  270: 
  271: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  272:     receive
  273:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  274:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  275:         {Port, eof} ->
  276:             Port ! {self(), close},
  277:             receive
  278:                 {Port, closed} ->
  279:                     true
  280:             end,
  281:             receive
  282:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  283:                     ok
  284:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  285:                     ok
  286:             end,
  287:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  288:     end.
  289: 
  290: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  291:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  292: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  293:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  294: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  295:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  296: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  297:     ok.
  298: 
  299: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  300:     unlink(Port),
  301:     exit(Port, die),
  302:     ct:fail(Reason).
  303: 
  304: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  305:     Cmd.
  306: %%     case os:type() of
  307: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  308: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  309: %%     end.
  310: 
  311: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  312: 
  313: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  314:     X = next_random(X0),
  315:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  316:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  317:         _ -> false
  318:     end;
  319: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  320:     true.
  321: 
  322: %% Generates a random byte list.
  323: 
  324: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  325:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  326: 
  327: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  328:     X = next_random(X0),
  329:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  330: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  331:     lists:reverse(Result).
  332: 
  333: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  334: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  335: 
  336: next_random(X) ->
  337:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  338: 
  339: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  340: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  341: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  342:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  343:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  344:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  345:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  346: 
  347:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  348: 
  349:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  350:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  351:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  352: 
  353:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  354: 
  355:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  356:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  357:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  358:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  359: 
  360:     %% Clean up.
  361:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  362: 
  363:     ok.
  364: 
  365: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  366: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  367: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  368:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  369:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  370:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  371:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  372: 
  373:     %% Create a zip archive
  374:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  375:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  376: 
  377:     %% Open archive
  378:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  379: 
  380:     %% List dir
  381:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  382: 
  383:     %% Get a file
  384:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  385:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  386:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  387:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  388:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  389: 
  390:     %% Get all files
  391:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  392:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  393:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  394: 
  395:     %% Close
  396:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  397: 
  398:     %% Clean up.
  399:     delete_files([Names]),
  400: 
  401:     ok.
  402: 
  403: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  404: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  405: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  406: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  407:     %% Create a zip archive
  408:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  409:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  410: 
  411:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  412:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  413: 
  414:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  415:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  416: 
  417:     %% Clean up.
  418:     delete_files([Zip]),
  419: 
  420:     ok.
  421: 
  422: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  423:     Self = self(),
  424:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  425:     receive
  426:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  427:             ZipSrv
  428:     end.
  429: 
  430: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  431:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  432:     receive
  433:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  434:             true
  435:     after 1000 ->
  436:             false
  437:     end.
  438: 
  439: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd, file_list and keep_old_files currently.
  440: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  441:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  442:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  443:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  444: 
  445:     %% create a temp directory
  446:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  447:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  448: 
  449:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  450: 
  451:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  452:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  453: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  454: 
  455:     %% Verify.
  456:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  457:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  458: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  459: 		  FList),
  460:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  461: 		  RetList),
  462: 
  463:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  464:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  465: 
  466:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  467: 
  468:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  469:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  470: 
  471:     %% Verify.
  472:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  473:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  474: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  475: 		  FList2),
  476:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  477: 		  RetList2),
  478: 
  479:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  480:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  481: 
  482:     OriginalFile1 = filename:join(Subdir, "abc.txt"),
  483:     OriginalFile2 = filename:join(Subdir, "quotes/rain.txt"),
  484: 
  485:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:dirname(OriginalFile1)),
  486:     ok = file:write_file(OriginalFile1, ["Original 1"]),
  487:     ok = file:make_dir(filename:dirname(OriginalFile2)),
  488:     ok = file:write_file(OriginalFile2, ["Original 2"]),
  489: 
  490:     FList3 = ["wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  491: 
  492:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  493:     {ok, RetList3} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories,keep_old_files]),
  494:     {ok, []} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories,keep_old_files]),
  495: 
  496:     %% Verify.
  497:     true = (length(RetList3) =:= 2),
  498:     {ok,<<"Original 1">>} = file:read_file(OriginalFile1),
  499:     {ok,<<"Original 2">>} = file:read_file(OriginalFile2),
  500:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  501: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  502: 		  FList3),
  503:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> 1 = delete_files([F]) end,
  504: 		  RetList3),
  505: 
  506:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  507:     2 = delete_files([OriginalFile1, OriginalFile2]),
  508:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  509:     ok.
  510: 
  511: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  512: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  513:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  514:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  515:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  516: 
  517:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  518:     %% clash.txt
  519:     %% ../clash.txt
  520:     %% ../above.txt
  521:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  522: 
  523:     %% create a temp directory
  524:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  525:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  526:     
  527:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  528:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  529:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  530: 
  531:     %% unzip in SubDir
  532:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  533: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  534: 
  535:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  536: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  537:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  538:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  539: 
  540:     %% clean up
  541:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  542:     
  543:      %% create the temp directory again
  544:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  545: 
  546:     %% unzip in SubDir
  547:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  548: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  549: 
  550:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  551: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  552:    
  553:     %% clean up
  554:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  555:     ok.
  556: 
  557: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  558: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  559:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  560:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  561:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  562: 
  563:     %% create a temp directory
  564:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  565:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  566: 
  567:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  568: 
  569:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  570: 
  571:     %% Verify.
  572:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  573: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  574: 		  FList),
  575:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  576:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  577:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  578:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  579:                           end
  580:                   end,
  581: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  582: 
  583:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  584:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  585:     ok.

  587: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  588: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  589:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  590:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  591:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  592:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  593: 
  594:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  595:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  596: 
  597:     %% Create a zip archive
  598:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  599:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  600: 
  601:     %% Open archive
  602:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  603: 
  604:     %% List dir
  605:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  606: 
  607:     %% Get a file
  608:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  609:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  610:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  611: 
  612:     %% Get all files
  613:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  614:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  615:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  616: 
  617:     %% Close
  618:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  619: 
  620:     %% Clean up.
  621:     delete_files([Names]),
  622: 
  623:     ok.

  627: 
  628:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  629:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  630: 
  631:     {ok,
  632:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =

  645: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  646: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  647:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  648: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  649:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  650:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  651: 
  652: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  653: char_seq(N, First) ->
  654:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  655: 
  656: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  657:     Result;
  658: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  659:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  660: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  661:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  662: 
  663: data_files() ->
  664:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  665:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  666:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  667:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  668:     create_files(Files),
  669:     Files.
  670: 
  671: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  672:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  673:     create_files(Rest);
  674: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  675:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  676:     create_files(Rest);
  677: create_files([]) ->
  678:     ok.

  690: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  691: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  692:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  693:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  694:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  695:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  696:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  697:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  698:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  699:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  700:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  701:                   end,
  702:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  703:     ok.
  704: 
  705: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  706:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  707:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  708: 
  709: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  710:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  711: 
  712:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  713:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  714:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  715:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  716:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  717:     case What(Full) of
  718:         Expected ->
  719:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  720:         Other ->
  721:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  722:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  723:     end.
  724:

  856:

  858:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  859:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),

  866: %% oac_files() ->
  867: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  868: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  869: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],
  870: %%     create_files(Files),

  872: 
  873: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  874: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  875: delete_files(List) ->
  876:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  877: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  878:     Cnt;
  879: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  880:     case file:delete(Item) of
  881:         ok ->
  882:             DelCnt = 1;
  883:         {error,eperm} ->
  884:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  885:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  886:             file:del_dir(Item);
  887:         {error,eacces} ->
  888:             %% We'll see about that!
  889:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  890:             case file:delete(Item) of
  891:                 ok ->
  892: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  893:                 {error,_} ->
  894:                     erlang:yield(),
  895:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  896:                     file:delete(Item),
  897:                     DelCnt = 1
  898:             end;
  899:         {error,_} ->
  900:             DelCnt = 0
  901:     end,
  902:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  903: 
  904: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  905: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  906:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  907:     Dir = "compress_control",
  908:     Files = [
  909:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  910:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  911:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  912:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  913:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  914:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  915:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  916:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  917:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  918:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  919:             ],
  920: 
  921:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  922: 			  Files,
  923: 			  [{compress, []}],
  924: 			  []),
  925: 
  926:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  927: 			  Files,
  928: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  929: 			  []),
  930: 
  931:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  932: 			  Files,
  933: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  934: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  935: 
  936:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  937: 			  Files,
  938: 			  [],
  939: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  940: 
  941:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  942: 			  Files,
  943: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  944: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  945: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  946: 
  947:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  948: 			  Files,
  949: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  950: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  951: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  952: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  953: 
  954:     ok.
  955: 
  956: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  957:     %% Cleanup
  958:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  959:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  960:     delete_files([Zip]),
  961:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  962: 
  963:     create_files(Files),
  964:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  965: 
  966:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  967:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  968:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  969:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  970:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  971: 
  972:     %% Cleanup
  973:     delete_files([Zip]),
  974:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  975: 
  976:     ok.
  977: 
  978: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  979:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  980:         case Kind of
  981:             dir ->
  982:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  983:             _   ->
  984:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  985:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  986:         end,
  987:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  988:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  989: 
  990:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  991:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  992:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  993:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  994:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  995:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  996:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  997:     end,
  998:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  999: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
 1000:     ok.
 1001: 
 1002: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
 1003:     false;
 1004: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
 1005:     CompressOpt =
 1006:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
 1007:             [] -> all;
 1008:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
 1009:         end,
 1010:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
 1011:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
 1012:     UncompressOpt =
 1013:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
 1014:             [] -> Default;
 1015:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
 1016:         end,
 1017:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
 1018:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
 1019: 
 1020: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
 1021:     case H of
 1022:         all ->
 1023:             extensions(T, H);
 1024:         H when is_list(H) ->
 1025:             extensions(T, H);
 1026:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
 1027:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
 1028:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
 1029:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
 1030:         _ ->
 1031:             extensions(T, Old)
 1032:     end;
 1033: extensions([], Old) ->
 1034:     Old.
 1035: 
 1036: foldl(Config) ->
 1037:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1038:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
 1039: 
 1040:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
 1041:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
 1042:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
 1043:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1044:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
 1045:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
 1046:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
 1047:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
 1048:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
 1049: 	try
 1050: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
 1051: 	catch
 1052: 	    throw:FooBin ->
 1053: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
 1054: 	end,
 1055:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
 1056:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1057: 
 1058:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
 1059:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
 1060:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
 1061: 
 1062:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1063:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1064: 
 1065:     ok.
 1066: 
 1067: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1068:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1069:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1070:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1071:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1072:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1073:                          ok
 1074:                  end,
 1075:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1076: 
 1077:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1078:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1079:                                                  ["none"]),
 1080:                         ok
 1081:                 end,
 1082:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1083: 
 1084:     ok.
 1085: 
 1086: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1087:     ok;
 1088: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1089:     try Bad() of
 1090:         ok ->
 1091:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1092:     catch
 1093:         C:R:Stk ->
 1094:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1095:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1096:     end.
 1097: 
 1098: unicode(Config) ->
 1099:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1100:         latin1 ->
 1101:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1102:         utf8 ->
 1103:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1104:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1105:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1106:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1107:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1108:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1109:             case has_zip() of
 1110:                 false ->
 1111:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1112:                 true ->
 1113:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1114:                         true ->
 1115:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1116:                             ok;
 1117:                         false ->
 1118:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1119:                     end
 1120:             end
 1121:     end.
 1122: 
 1123: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1124:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1125:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1126: 
 1127:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1128:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1129: 
 1130: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1131:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1132:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1133:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1134:     [begin
 1135:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1136:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1137:      end ||
 1138:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1139:     ok.
 1140: 
 1141: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1142:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1143:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1144:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1145:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1146:     {ok, Archive} =
 1147:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1148:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1149: 
 1150: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1151:     case test_zip1() of
 1152:         false ->
 1153:             ok;
 1154:         true ->
 1155:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1156:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1157:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1158:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1159:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1160:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1161:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1162:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1163:     end.
 1164: 
 1165: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1166:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1167:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1168:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1169:     ok.
 1170: 
 1171: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1172:     case test_zip1() of
 1173:         false ->
 1174:             ok;
 1175:         true ->
 1176:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1177:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1178:             Comment = [Char],
 1179:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1180:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1181: 
 1182:             {ok, _} =
 1183:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1184:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1185:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1186:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1187: 
 1188:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1189:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1190:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1191:     end.
 1192: 
 1193: test_zip1() ->
 1194:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1195: 
 1196: has_zip() ->
 1197:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false andalso element(1, os:type()) =:= unix.
 1198: 
 1199: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1200:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1201:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1202: 
 1203: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1204:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1205:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1206:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1207:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1208:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1209:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1210:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1211:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1212:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1213:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1214:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1215:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1216:     ok.
 1217: 
 1218: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1219:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1220:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1221:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1222:     Comment = [9999999],
 1223:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1224:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1225: 
 1226: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1227:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1228:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1229:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1230:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1231: 
 1232: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1233:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1234:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1235:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1236:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1237:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1238:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1239:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1240:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1241:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1242:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1243:             ok;
 1244:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1245:     end.
 1246: 
 1247: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1248:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1249:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1250:              receive
 1251:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1252:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1253:                               Reciver()
 1254:              end
 1255:      end)().
 1256:     
 1257: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1258:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1259:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1260:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1261:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1262:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1263:     ok.
 1264: 
 1265: mode(Config) ->
 1266: 
 1267:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1268:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1269:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1270: 
 1271:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1272:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1273:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1274:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1275:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode }} = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1276: 
 1277:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1278:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1279:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1280: 
 1281:     NestedFile = filename:join(Directory, "nested"),
 1282:     file:write_file(NestedFile, "bbb"),
 1283:     {ok, NestedFI } = file:read_file_info(NestedFile),
 1284: 
 1285:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1286:     {ok, #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode }} = file:read_file_info(Directory),
 1287: 
 1288:     ?assertMatch(
 1289:        {ok, Archive},
 1290:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1291: 
 1292:     OrigExecMode777 = OrigExecMode band 8#777,
 1293:     OrigDirMode777 = OrigDirMode band 8#777,
 1294:     OrigNestedFileMode777 = NestedFI#file_info.mode band 8#777,
 1295: 
 1296:     ?assertMatch(
 1297:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1298:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigDirMode777 }},
 1299:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/nested", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigNestedFileMode777 }},
 1300:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = OrigExecMode777 }} ]},
 1301:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1302: 
 1303:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1304:     ?assertMatch(
 1305:        {ok, ["dir/","dir/nested","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1306: 
 1307:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1308:         true ->
 1309:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1310:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1311:             ?assertEqual(ExecMode band 8#777, OrigExecMode777),
 1312: 
 1313:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1314:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1315:             ?assertEqual(DirMode band 8#777, OrigDirMode777),
 1316: 
 1317:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = NestedMode }} =
 1318:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir/nested")),
 1319:             ?assertEqual(NestedMode band 8#777, OrigNestedFileMode777);
 1320:         false ->
 1321:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1322:             ok
 1323:     end,
 1324: 
 1325:     ok.
 1326: 
 1327: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1328: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1329: %%  * compressed size
 1330: %%  * uncompressed size
 1331: %%  * relative offset
 1332: %%  * starting disk
 1333: %%
 1334: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1335: zip64_central_headers() -> [{timetrap, {minutes, 60}}].
 1336: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1337: 
 1338:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1339:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1340: 
 1341:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1342:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1343:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1344: 
 1345:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1346:     %% different header combinations.
 1347:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1348:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1349:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1350:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1351:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1352:     %%
 1353:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1354: 
 1355:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1356:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1357:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1358:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1359:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../medium.txt"),
 1360:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1361:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1362:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1363:     ok = file:make_link(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt"),
 1364:                         filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1365:     ?assertMatch(
 1366:        {ok, Archive},
 1367:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1368:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1369:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1370:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1371: 
 1372:     %% Check that list archive works
 1373:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1374:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1375:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1376:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1377:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1378:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1379:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1380:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1381:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1382:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1383:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1384:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1385:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1386:          ]} =
 1387:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1388:     ok.
 1389: 
 1390: unzip64_central_headers() -> [{timetrap, {minutes, 60}}].
 1391: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1392: 
 1393:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1394:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1395:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1396:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1397:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1398: 
 1399:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1400:     lists:map(
 1401:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1402:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1403:               ?assertMatch(
 1404:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1405:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1406:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1407:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1408:           F(Name) ->
 1409:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1410:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1411:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1412: 
 1413:     ok.
 1414: 
 1415: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1416: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1417: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1418: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1419: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1420: %%
 1421: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1422: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1423: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1424: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1425: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1426: 
 1427:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1428:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1429:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1430: 
 1431:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1432: 
 1433:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1434:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1435:     lists:foreach(
 1436:       fun(I) ->
 1437:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1438:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1439:     ?assertMatch(
 1440:        {ok, Archive},
 1441:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1442: 
 1443:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1444:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1445: 
 1446:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1447:     ?assertMatch(
 1448:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1449:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1450:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1451:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1452:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1453: 
 1454:     ok.
 1455: 
 1456: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1457: %% mtime of the file
 1458: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1459:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1460:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1461:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1462:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1463: 
 1464:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1465:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1466:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1467: 
 1468:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1469:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1470: 
 1471:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1472:     ?assertMatch(
 1473:        {ok, Archive},
 1474:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1475: 
 1476:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1477:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1478:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1479: 
 1480:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1481:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1482:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1483: 
 1484:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1485:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1486:     %% are in precise.
 1487:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1488:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1489: 
 1490:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1491:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1492: 
 1493:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1494:     ?assertMatch(
 1495:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1496:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1497: 
 1498:     {ok, UnzipFI } =
 1499:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1500: 
 1501: 
 1502:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1503: 
 1504:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1505: 
 1506:     assert_timestamp(UnzipMode, UnzipFI, ZMtime),
 1507: 
 1508:     ok.
 1509: 
 1510: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1511: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1512: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1513: 
 1514:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1515:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1516:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1517:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1518: 
 1519:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1520:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1521:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1522: 
 1523:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1524:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1525: 
 1526:     ?assertMatch(
 1527:        {ok, Archive},
 1528:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1529: 
 1530:     %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1531:     %% the mtime will be correct here
 1532:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1533:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1534:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1535: 
 1536:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1537:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1538:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1539: 
 1540:     ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1541: 
 1542:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1543:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1544: 
 1545:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1546:     ?assertMatch(
 1547:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1548:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1549: 
 1550:     {ok, UnzipFI } =
 1551:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt"),[raw]),
 1552: 
 1553:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1554: 
 1555:     UnzipMode = un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)),
 1556: 
 1557:     assert_timestamp(UnzipMode, UnzipFI, ZMtime ),
 1558: 
 1559:     ok.
 1560: 
 1561: assert_timestamp(unemzip, _FI, _ZMtime) ->
 1562:     %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1563:     ok;
 1564: assert_timestamp(_, #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime, mtime = UnZMtime, ctime = UnZCtime }, ZMtime) ->
 1565: 
 1566:     ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1567: 
 1568:     %% both atime and ctime behave very differently on different platforms, so it is rather hard to test.
 1569:     %% atime is sometimes set to ctime for unknown reasons, and sometimes set to 1970...
 1570:     ?assert(UnZAtime =:= UnZMtime orelse UnZAtime =:= UnZCtime orelse UnZAtime =:= {{1970,1,1},{1,0,0}}),
 1571: 
 1572:     %% On windows the ctime and mtime are the same so
 1573:     %% we cannot compare them.
 1574:     [?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime) || os:type() =/= {win32,nt}],
 1575: 
 1576:     ok.
 1577: 
 1578: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1579: 
 1580:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1581:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1582:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1583:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1584: 
 1585:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1586:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1587:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1588: 
 1589:     ?assertMatch(
 1590:        {ok, Archive},
 1591:        zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1592: 
 1593:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1594:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1595:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1596: 
 1597:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1598:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1599: 
 1600:     ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1601:     ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1602: 
 1603:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1604:     ?assertMatch(
 1605:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1606:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1607: 
 1608:     {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1609:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1610: 
 1611:     case un_z64(get_value(unzip, Config)) =/= unemzip of
 1612:         true ->
 1613:             ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1614:             ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1615:         _ ->
 1616:             %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1617:             ok
 1618:     end,
 1619: 
 1620:     ok.
 1621: 
 1622: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1623: %%% Generic zip interface
 1624: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1625: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1626:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1627:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1628: zip(z64_zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1629:     zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1630: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1631:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1632:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1633:     {ok, Archive};
 1634: zip(z64_ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1635:     zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1636: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1637:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1638:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1639: zip(z64_emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1640:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1641:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1642:     try
 1643:         erpc:call(
 1644:           Node,
 1645:           fun() ->
 1646:             ?MODULE:zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts)
 1647:           end)
 1648:     after
 1649:         catch peer:stop(Peer)
 1650:     end;
 1651: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1652:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1653:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1654: 
 1655:     
 1656:     %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1657:     %% the binary for files that are the same size as those are the same file.
 1658:     %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1659: 
 1660:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1661:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1662:         fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1663:                 AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1664:                 {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1665:                 CacheKey = {Fi#file_info.type, Fi#file_info.size},
 1666:                 {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1667:                     if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1668:                             {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1669:                             lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ CacheKey => <<>> },
 1670:                                             [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1671:                         Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1672:                             {[],
 1673:                                 case maps:find(CacheKey, Cache) of
 1674:                                     {ok, _} -> Cache;
 1675:                                     error ->
 1676:                                         {ok, Data} = read_file(
 1677:                                                     file:open(AbsFn, [read, raw, binary]),
 1678:                                                     Fi#file_info.size),
 1679:                                         Cache#{ CacheKey => Data }
 1680:                                 end}
 1681:                     end,
 1682:                 {[{Fn, maps:get(CacheKey, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1683:         end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1684:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1685: 
 1686: %% Special read_file that works on windows on > 4 GB files
 1687: read_file({ok, D}, Size) ->
 1688:     Bin = iolist_to_binary(read_file(D, Size)),
 1689:     erlang:garbage_collect(), %% Do a GC to get rid of all intermediate binaries
 1690:     {ok, Bin};
 1691: read_file({error, _} = E, _Size) ->
 1692:     E;
 1693: read_file(eof = E, _Size) ->
 1694:     E;
 1695: read_file(D, 0) ->
 1696:     file:close(D),
 1697:     [];
 1698: read_file(D, Size) ->
 1699:     {ok, B} = file:read(D, min(1 bsl 30, Size)),
 1700:     [B | read_file(D, Size - byte_size(B))].
 1701: 
 1702: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1703:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1704: unzip(z64_unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1705:     unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts);
 1706: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1707:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1708:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1709:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1710:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1711:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1712:            lists:flatmap(
 1713:              fun(Ln) ->
 1714:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1715:                          nomatch -> [];
 1716:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1717:                      end
 1718:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1719: unzip(z64_unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1720:     unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts);
 1721: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1722:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1723:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1724:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1725: unzip(z64_unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1726:     %% Run in peer node so that memory issues don't crash test node
 1727:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => emzip_peer_args() }),
 1728:     try
 1729:       erpc:call(
 1730:         Node,
 1731:         fun() ->
 1732:             unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts)
 1733:         end)
 1734:     after
 1735:         catch peer:stop(Peer)
 1736:     end;
 1737: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1738:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1739:     
 1740:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1741:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1742:             [begin
 1743:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1744:                     $/ ->
 1745:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1746:                     _ ->
 1747:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1748:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1749:                 end,
 1750:                 F -- Cwd
 1751:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1752: 
 1753: emzip_peer_args() ->
 1754:     8 = erlang:system_info(wordsize),%% Supercarrier only supported on 64-bit
 1755:     ["+MMscs",integer_to_list(?EMZIP64_MEM_USAGE div (1024 * 1024))].
 1756: 
 1757: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1758:     {ok, SrcInfo} = file:read_file_info(Source),
 1759:     {ok, TgtInfo} = file:read_file_info(Target),
 1760:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.size, TgtInfo#file_info.size),
 1761:     ?assertEqual(SrcInfo#file_info.mode, TgtInfo#file_info.mode),
 1762: 
 1763:     {ok, Src} = file:open(Source, [read, binary]),
 1764:     {ok, Tgt} = file:open(Target, [read, binary]),
 1765: 
 1766:     cmp(Src, Tgt, 0),
 1767: 
 1768:     file:close(Src),
 1769:     file:close(Tgt).
 1770: 
 1771: %% Check if first 100 MB are the same
 1772: cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos) when Pos < 100 bsl 20 ->
 1773:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1774:     case {file:read(Src, 20 bsl 20), file:read(Tgt, 20 bsl 20)} of
 1775:         {{ok, Data}, {ok, Data}} ->
 1776:             cmp(Src, Tgt, Pos + 20 bsl 20);
 1777:         {E, E} ->
 1778:             ok
 1779:     end;
 1780: cmp(_Src, _Tgt, _) ->
 1781:     ok.
 1782: 
 1783: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1784:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1785:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1786:     Res.
 1787: 
 1788: disc_free(Path) ->
 1789:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1790: 
 1791:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1792:     Partitions =
 1793:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1794:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1795: 
 1796:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1797:     %% path first.
 1798:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1799:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1800:         [] -> error
 1801:     end.
 1802: 
 1803: memsize() ->
 1804:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1805:         undefined ->
 1806:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1807:             Tot;
 1808:         Available ->
 1809:             Available
 1810:     end.
